vitals: Temperature: 37.7°C (99.9°F) Blood pressure: 120/68 mmHg Pulse rate: 90 bpm Respiratory rate: 24 breaths per minute

labs_and_diagnostics: Cbc: not reported Microbiology serology pcr: antiretroviral drugs and co-trimoxazole stopped on admission; blood cultures taken and both came back negative; rapid malaria test was also negative Malaria tests: negative
differential_diagnosis: Main alternatives: ["Stevens–Johnson syndrome (SJS)/toxic epidermal necrolysis", "Malaria", "Drug hypersensitivity reaction"] Justifications: ["Generalized skin rash with mucosal involvement, fever and HIV status", "Negative malaria tests but compatible symptoms and travel history", "Recent drug exposure to antiretrovirals and co-trimoxazole"]
management_and_clinical_course: Initial treatment: ["0.9% normal saline as mouthwash", "Dexamethasone eye ointment", "IV fluids and a urinary catheter"] Response to treatment: Fever and cough settled spontaneously; discharged after 10 days in hospital Complications: None reported Outcome: Full recovery with no further rash
final_diagnosis: Disease name: Stevens–Johnson syndrome (SJS)/toxic epidermal necrolysis Causative agent: Antiretroviral drugs and co-trimoxazole Confirmation method: Clinical presentation, rash pattern, HIV status, and response to treatment Evidence: ["Generalized skin rash with mucosal involvement", "Fever and HIV status", "Response to withdrawal of antiretrovirals and co-trimoxazole"]
